1:
Why are you proud of making trouble, you mighty man?
\q The covenant faithfulness of God comes every day.
\q
2:
Your tongue plans destruction
\q like a sharp razor, working deceitfully.
3:
You love evil more than good
\q and lying rather than speaking righteousness.
\qs Selah\qs*
4:
You love all words that devour others,
\q you deceitful tongue.
\q
5:
God will likewise destroy you forever;
\q he will take you up and pluck you out of your tent
\q and root you out of the land of the living.
\qs Selah\qs*
7:
"See, this is a man who did not make God his refuge,
\q but he trusted in the abundance of his wealth,
\q and he was strong when he destroyed others."
9:
I will give you thanks forever for what you have done.
\q I will wait for your name, because it is good,
\q in the presence of your godly people.
52:
\m
\d For the chief musician. A maschil of David; when Doeg the Edomite came and told Saul, and said to him, "David has come to the
house of Ahimelech."
\q
